'Letters' is the first studio album by English singer-songwriter and guitarist
Matt Cardle. It was released on 17 October 2011. Cardle worked with various
songwriters on the album including Eg White and James Walsh. He co-wrote all the
tracks except for his X Factor winner's single, "When We Collide" and the single
"Run For Your Life", written by Gary Barlow

It peaked at number two on the UK Albums Chart behind Noel Gallagher. The album
went platinum in early 2012. http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/interviews/a360555/matt-cardle-
interview-i-dont-want-next-album-to-be-overproduced.html The Letters Tour
in support of the album began in February 2012.
